title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Child Functional Abdominal Pain
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Child Functional Abdominal Pain provides criteria for diagnosis of child functional abdominal pain.

orgreference.text: Hyams J, Di lorenzo C, Forbes D, et al. Childhood functional gastrointestinal disorders: child/adolescent. Gastroenterology. 2006;130(5):1527-37.

other_refer.text: Di Lorenzo C, Colletti RB, Lehmann HP, et al. Chronic abdominal pain in children: a technical report of the american academy of pediatrics and the north american society for pediatric gastroenterology, hepatology and nutrition. J Pediatr Gastroenterol Nutr. 2005;40(3):249-261.
van Assen T, de Jager-Kievit JWAJ, Scheltinga MR, Roumen RMH. Chronic abdominal wall pain misdiagnosed as functional abdominal pain. J Am Board Fam Med. 2013;26(6):738-744.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for child functional abdominal pain, patient must have the following (≥4 times per month for ≥2 months prior):

  1. Episodic or continuous abdominal pain that does not occur solely during physiologic events (e.g. eating, menses).
  2. Insufficient criteria for irritable bowel syndrome, functional dyspepsia, or abdominal migraine.
  3. After appropriate evaluation, the abdominal pain cannot be fully explained by another medical condition.
